newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia late rubber SIR3CV up on shoe demand.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia late rubber SIR3CV up on shoe demand.

text.p: Indonesian tyre-grade SIR20 offer prices were flat, with no deals heard, but SIR3CV edged up on expected higher demand for shoes at year-end, dealers said.
Dealers said February/March SIR20 offer prices remained at 55.00-55.50 cents/lb fob in Medan, 54.75-55.25 fob in Surabaya, Padang and Palembang as well as 54.25-54.75 fob in Pontianak and Jambi.
"People are more likely to buy a new pair of shoes for the year-end celebrations, this may explain why we've got rising enquiries on SIR3CV," one Medan dealer said.
"In the first two weeks of December alone we have secured deals worth 350 tonnes of SIR3CV, up from a monthly average of 300 tonnes this year," the dealer added.
Dealers said they expected SIR3CV to rise to around 145 cents/kg from the current 142 due to the expected higher demand. It was previously traded at 141.
Foreign firms last bought February/March SIR20 at 55.00 cents/lb fob in Palembang and at 54.75 fob in Surabaya on Thursday against the previous 54.50 fob in Palembang.
